Instruction: Marinate chicken in yogurt in a sealed bag in the refrigerator for 8 hours to overnight.
Rinse yogurt off chicken pieces and pat dry with a paper towel.
Combine milk and beaten eggs until smooth. Mix together flour, salt, pepper, curry powder, and paprika in a wide, shallow bowl.
Coat each chicken piece in the milk mixture and then dredge in the flour mixture until fully coated, placing them on a plate as you coat each piece.
Heat oil in a deep fryer or large saucepan to a temperature of 375 degrees Fahrenheit.
Fry chicken pieces in the hot oil until cooked through and golden brown, about 10 to 15 minutes per batch. Use a thermometer to ensure the chicken reaches 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
